rmexact 0.0.1

    • Introduction to the `{rmexact}` R Package

    Split likelihood ratio test for random mating

    rmslrt.Rd

    Implements the split likelihood ratio test of Wasserman et al. (2020 when testing for random mating in autopolyploids.

    rmslrt(nvec, sprop = 0.5, log_p = FALSE, nrep = 10)

    Arguments

    nvec

    The vector of genotype counts

    sprop

    The proportional split.

    log_p

    Should we return the log p-value?

    nrep

    Number of iterations

    Value

    the p-value or the log of the p-value

    References

    • Wasserman, L., Ramdas, A., & Balakrishnan, S. (2020). Universal inference. Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences, 117(29), 16880-16890. doi:10.1073/pnas.1922664117

    Examples

    if (FALSE) {
set.seed(1)
p <- c(1/3, 1/3, 1/3)
q <- stats::convolve(p, rev(p), type = "open")
nvec <- c(stats::rmultinom(n = 1, size = 100, prob = q))
rmslrt(nvec, sprop = 0.5, nrep = 100)

q <- c(0.25, 0.2, 0.1, 0.2, 0.25)
nvec <- c(stats::rmultinom(n = 1, size = 100, prob = q))
rmslrt(nvec, sprop = 0.5, nrep = 100)
}
